author: mehdi.aouadi
content: Regarding the `InclusionListByCommitteeIndices` RPC method https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/_features/eip7805/p2p-interface.md#the-reqresp-domain I'm thinking we could serve it using the `Store` since we cache the ILs there. But in the current spec we cache the non signed InclusionList objects: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/85e6451072531b6bc00a66e301f0636711f2886c/specs/_features/eip7805/fork-choice.md?plain=1#L196. I'm thinking we could cache the SignedInclusionList objects instead and serve the RPC requests from the store. Any thoughts about that?

author: terencechain
content: Makes sense, but isn't this more of a client implementation detail? Traditionally, the P2P spec doesn't rely on helpers from the fork choice spec, so it doesn't really make sense to alter the fork choice spec just so the P2P spec can reference it. No strong opinion though.

author: mehdi.aouadi
content: I agree that it's an implementation detail (in the current Teku implementation, I ended up having a separate cache for the RPC requests with the signed ILs which is not ideal) and that the fork choice spec doesn't require the signature but that would make the implementation cleaner imo. Curious to know how other clients serve the signed ILs...
